snippet: The defense’s pledge to file “vigorous post-trial motions” seeking to have the verdict set aside offer a preview of how it would appeal Mr. Silver’s conviction on graft charges.
abstract: Assertion by Sheldon Silver's lawyer that they will file post-trial motions to set guilty verdict of former New York State Assembly speaker aside offers preview of defense's arguments for appeal; defense will likely argue that prosecutors did not prove quid-pro-quo relationship between Silver and those people prosecutors say benefited from official actions Silver took while in office.
lead_paragraph: The defense’s pledge to file “vigorous post-trial motions” seeking to have the verdict set aside offer a preview of how it would appeal Mr. Silver’s conviction on graft charges.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver’s Lawyers Are Likely to Argue U.S. Failed to Prove Quid Pro Quo
headline.print_headline: Hints of an Appeal After Silver’s Conviction
